courseDescription:
The alphabet serves as a basis for any language learning and aids our ability to read and write as individuals. This course introduces the Korean alphabet, called ‘Hangul’, and outlines the sounds attached to every consonant and vowel. Numbers are a small but valuable part of any language because you use them extensively in everyday life. Learn how to count using the two number systems employed in the Korean language and study how to use these systems. We use days of the week, colours and months of the year in daily conversations. Gain an insight into the Korean vocabulary for each of these and family-related words, which are essential because we spend a substantial amount of time with our families. Do you have friends and families that are native Korean speakers? We will teach you different terms related to family and relatives and help you build your vocabulary for household use.

Emotions can be positive or negative. You'll often find yourself in situations where you need to communicate them properly. Discover different ways to express yourself and share your feelings in particular situations. Greetings are essential and serve as a first approach to communicating with someone new. Explore various useful Korean phrases used for meeting people and striking up positive conversations. We'll teach you several valuable sentences commonly used in a telephonic conversation. Travelling to a new country requires you to have some travel-related vocabulary and phrases at your disposal to move around as a tourist quickly. We will teach you travel and tourism-related phrases, including asking for directions and locations. Do you like to go outside and eat at restaurants? We cover a range of basic Korean words and expressions to use at a restaurant and order the food you want.

We designed this course for people who want to learn Korean and interact with Korean speakers. This basic-level course does not require any prior understanding of the Korean language. Do you know that South Korea is famous for its pop culture and technological advancements? All this makes travelling to South Korea desirable for tourism and work-related opportunities. Learning Korean will greatly help you if you want to visit Korea or work there. Moreover, learning a new language improves your brain functions by boosting your cognitive and problem-solving skills. Don't miss out on the opportunity to learn Korean. Join the course now and learn for free!
